result.execSummary:
Bernard Reyes was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Bernard Reyes was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bernard Reyes

records.addlTxt:
9:10 AM Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bernard Reyes not in court.  Attorney David Patton in court for Bernard Reyes. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defendant has been extradited to State of Oklahoma.
In 22CF315, State requests to issue a warrant.
Defense obj.
BTC: In 22CF315, Bench warrant authorized, no action taken on bond.

9:51 AM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bernard Reyes in court, in custody.  Attorney David Patton in court for Bernard Reyes. Court Reporter: Saige Smith. 
State of Oklahoma req extradition.
Defendant does not contest.
Colloquy conducted with def re: right to hearing.
BTC:  The court finds that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly, & intelligently waives extradition.

State of Oklahoma req extradition.
Defendant does not contest.
Colloquy conducted with def re: right to hearing.
BTC:  The court finds that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly, & intelligently waives extradition.
